content.question: A water tank standing on level ground is in the shape of a right circular cylinder, as shown. Water is flowing into the tank at the rate of <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> cubic meters per minute. The tank has a radius of <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> meters and a height of <math alttext="7" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn></math> meters. At what rate, in meters per minute, is the depth of the water changing when the water is <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> meters deep? (The volume <math alttext="V" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>V</mi></math> of a right circular cylinder with radius <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> and height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math> is <math alttext="V equals, pi r squared times h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>Ï€</mi><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>h</mi></mrow></math>.)

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
